posts.author: Sarah Rose
posts.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
posts.desc: Forget short term results. You need a long term strategy that works for you...
posts.content:
You'll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

To add new posts, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-post.ext and includes the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets:
posts.codeSnippet:
def print_hi(name)
  puts "Hi, #{name}"
end
print_hi('Tom')
#=> prints 'Hi, Tom' to STDOUT.
posts.footer: Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll's GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll Talk.

posts.author: Admin
posts.title: Two Before No In Nature
posts.desc: The path of a programmer is filled with continuous learning and discovery...
posts.content: Continuous learning is essential in the tech industry. Every day brings new technologies, frameworks, and best practices to discover and master.

posts.author: Admin
posts.title: Design is not just what it looks like
posts.desc: Good design is about making things simple and intuitive...
posts.content: Great design combines aesthetics with functionality. It's about creating experiences that users love.

posts.author: Admin
posts.title: Development Best Practices
posts.desc: Learn the best practices for modern web development and clean code...
posts.content: Writing clean, maintainable code is crucial for long-term project success. Follow established patterns and best practices.
posts.codeSnippet:
// Best practices
- Write clean code
- Document your work
- Test thoroughly
